contentrichtext.text: '''Xavier de Planhol''' (born 3 February 1926 in [[Paris]]<ref>Nouveau dictionnaire national des contemporains. - Paris : Robin, 1961-1968</ref>) is an Emeritus Professor of Geography at the [[University of Paris-Sorbonne]] and a universally acknowledged authority on political geography. From 1958, when he began to publish monographs and articles during his first fieldwork in [[Azerbaijan (Iran)|Azerbaijan]], and later in the [[Alborz]] region of [[Iran]], to his monumental and highly acclaimed, ''Les Nations du Prophète'' (1993) and ''Minorités en Islam'' (1997), he has maintained his deep interest in [[Persian Empire|Persia]] and the Iranian civilization. He is also a contributor to [[Encyclopædia Iranica]], submitting articles ranging from "Abadan" to "Boundaries", "Cholera", "Darya?", "Earthquakes", "Famines", and a series of forthcoming articles on "Geography". A bibliography of Professor Xavier de Planhol’s wide-ranging publications up to 1995, has been compiled and published by Professor Daniel Balland in ''Geographie Historique et Culturelle de l’Europe: Hommage au Professor Xavier de Planhol'', by Jean-Robert Pitte (1995).<ref>[http://www.iranica.com/newsite/aboutiranica/int_committee.html Encyclopaedia Iranica]</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Authority control|VIAF=88798682}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Planhol, Xavier de | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = French geographer | DATE OF BIRTH = 3 February 1926 | PLACE OF BIRTH = Paris | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Planhol, Xavier De}} [[Category:1926 births]] [[Category:French geographers]] [[Category:University of Paris faculty]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Iranologists]] [[Category:Members of Academia Europaea]]
